content: away with the fairies by lettice rose a perky little afghan square which would be equally at home in realistic colours or in the traditional fairy tale toadstool colours of red and white or just any old colour that takes your fancy a simple colour scheme with variegated caps looks particularly magical this is quite an easy design the only slightly tricky part is the unusual cluster stitch used to form the mushroom cap and a bit of back bar working have fun with it materials my sample was made using stylecraft special dk and a 4 mm hook which produced a 9 75 square yarn colour a stone mushroom caps yarn colour b meadow background grass yarn colour c parchment mushroom stalks stitch holder size 12 in worsted with 5 5 mm hook 9 75 in dk with a 4 mm hook back bar working in rounds 2 and 14 the stitches are formed by stitching into the back bar of the previous round this is the third thread found behind the front and back loops this has the effect in round 2 of showing an entire ring of round 1 stitches on the surface in round 14 it carries the working thread invisibly from corner to corner © 2018 lettice rose away with the fairies afghan square page 1 of 4 stitches
